entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch
entry.summary:
Scattered thunderstorms about parts of Canterbury should be easing tonight.
For parts of the Canterbury Plains between Geraldine and Christchurch (including Banks Peninsula), a few of these thunderstorms may be severe until midnight tonight (Thursday) with localised downpours of 25-40mm and large hail in excess of 20mm diameter.
Rainfall of this intensity can cause surface and/or flash flooding, especially about low-lying areas such as streams, rivers or narrow valleys, and may also lead to slips. Driving conditions will also be hazardous with surface flooding and poor visibility in heavy rain. Large hail can cause significant damage to crops, orchards, vines, glass-houses and vehicles, as well as make driving conditions hazardous. If any small tornadoes do occur, they will be short-lived and very localised. The thunderstorm activity dies away tonight.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning
entry.summary:
At 09:52 pm, MetService weather radar detected severe thunderstorms near ASHBURTON, WINCHMORE, HINDS, LONGBEACH, THE ASHBURTON RIVER MOUTH and TINWALD.
These severe thunderstorms are moving towards the northeast, and are expected to lie near ASHBURTON, RAKAIA, WINCHMORE, CHERTSEY, SEAFIELD, PENDARVES and DROMORE at 10:22 pm and near RAKAIA and CHERTSEY at 10:52 pm.
These thunderstorms are expected to be accompanied by very heavy rain and large hail.
Impact:
Very heavy rain can cause surface and/or flash flooding about streams, gullies and urban areas, and make driving conditions extremely hazardous.
Large hail can cause significant damage to crops, orchards, vines, glasshouses and vehicles, and make driving conditions hazardous.
